definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: Then it is, perhaps, that life is a dream.
sentences.chinese: 這可能就是所謂的人生如夢吧。

sentences.english: Life is a dream , dream it.
Life, what is it but a dream?
Life is but a dream, be endless , be also brief.
sentences.chinese: 人生如夢，是漫長的，也是簡短的。

sentences.english: Dreaming all these years, finally the right decision.
sentences.chinese: 歷經多年人生如夢，最後終於領悟生命的真諦。

sentences.english: A man grey before his time.
sentences.chinese: 人生如夢，一樽還酹江月。

sentences.english: Life is as short as a dream;
sentences.chinese: 人生如夢，珍惜才能永恆。

sentences.english: After all, life is just like a dream.
The life like dream, comes in a hurry, the twinkling of an eye several years passed by.
sentences.chinese: 人生如夢，來來匆匆，一眨眼就十幾年過去了。

definition: a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
lit. cool breeze and bright moon (idiom)/fig. peaceful and clear night/(allusively) living a solitary and quiet life
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
